programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: The latest news, sport, business and weather from the BBC's Breakfast team.

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford, Julia Somerville and Angela Rippon investigate more of your stories on Rip Off Britain, including, in this edition, the shocking case of a man whose phone was stolen right out of his hands and discovered that his bank accounts had been drained via his online banking apps. Why did his bank refuse to reimburse him? Also, the people hoodwinked by a company claiming it was making legitimate tax rebate claims on their behalf - but the taxman disagreed, and wanted it all back. And the advice clinic takes on holiday refunds and investigates the problems consumers face who don't use the internet. Tune in for plenty of advice to keep your money safe.

programme.title: Frontline Fightback S3 (6/10)
programme.desc: A driver is ambushed by a carjacking gang in a terrifying incident outside his home.

programme.title: Defenders UK S5 (6/10)
programme.desc: Our Defenders are called in when a seven-year-old boy suffers a fatal electric shock.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer S24 (41/80)
programme.desc: Featuring bungalows in Southampton and Shropshire and a return visit to Clay Cross.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Caroline Hawley is in Hemswell, Lincolnshire, with the reds and the blues, led by experts Izzie Balmer and Mark Stacey. Both teams are eager to make a profit at the auction, but who will win? Meanwhile, Caroline visits a local man who is upcycling antique objects and turning them into innovative lamps.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international news from the BBC.

programme.title: Doctors (Red) S24 (n°67)
programme.desc: «Red»Emma and Rob are mortified after their night of drinking.

programme.title: Money for Nothing S14 (4/20)
programme.desc: The team upcycle some metal railings, a tired writing bureau and a marble collection.

programme.title: Escape to the Country S23 (46/55)
programme.desc: Jules Hudson helps a couple to find their forever home in Northumberland.

programme.title: Chelsea Flower Show
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman and Angellica Bell have exclusive access to the glitz and glamour of opening day of the RHS Chelsea Flower Show 2023. They're joined by a team of gardening experts, including Rachel de Thame, who will be travelling the world without even leaving the showground, and Toby Buckland, who will be showing us how to upgrade our gardens the Chelsea way. Carol Klein is searching out the hidden treasures we're all going to want in our gardens, while James Wong uncovers the secrets to our lawns. And as the show hosts its very first wedding, Nicki gets a lesson in creating floral garlands worthy of any celebration.

programme.title: The Repair Shop S9
programme.desc: The team restore a statue, a clock from Trinidad and a painting that has seen better days.

programme.title: Pointless S28
programme.desc: The quiz in which contestants try to score as few points as possible by plumbing the depths of their general knowledge to come up with the answers no-one else could think of. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and co-host Sally Lindsay.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international news from the BBC.

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: If it's got Britain talking, then it will get talked about on The One Show. Live every evening Monday to Friday, we bring you the stories that matter from across the country.

programme.title: EastEnders (n°6701)
programme.desc: Stacey takes matters into her own hands, and Ben struggles to deal with recent events.

programme.title: Panorama (Landfill: Britain's Toxic Secrets) (n°37)
programme.desc: «Landfill: Britain's Toxic Secrets»Investigative documentary.

programme.title: Scam Interceptors S1 (6/10)
programme.desc: Rav Wilding hunts down the scammers plaguing our lives.

programme.title: Steeltown Murders S1 (2/4)
programme.desc: Paul begins the swabbing operation, but it may not be as straightforward as he had hoped.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international news, with reports from BBC correspondents worldwide.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You S65
programme.desc: Mel Giedroyc is guest host, with panellists comedian Chris McCausland and broadcaster Kirsty Wark joining team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop as they delve into the news.

programme.title: Glow Up: Britain's Next Make-Up Star S5
programme.desc: The MUAs get spooked on the set of Ghosts while working in pairs to create plague victims.
